title: (x) Art Deco face in "The Barrymore Awards" logo - Casablanca RR {Norbert}
content:
I've got to redraw a logo (attached), the vector art for which is lost or never existed, and it's not worth my time to redraw the type.

I did my usual battery of research on this one, but I'm sure it's something so obvious I just went right past it. It's also possible it was a bundled font. I've checked out [Carlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217130240/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/carlos/familytree.html), [Newport Land](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217130240/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/newport-land/), [Romeo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217130240/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/romeo/), and [Casablanca](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217130240/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5ZR). I've scrolled through 975 fonts on My Fonts after searching 'art deco condensed'. It's definitely coming from the same inspirational source as the others: Carlos Winkow's Electra from around 1940 ( [according to Font Bureau](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217130240/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Romeo)). However, every time I get close, some aspect is off. Few are condensed enough or thick enough. I wonder whether it's been modified by the previous designer, but I can't tell either way.

So, I turn to all of you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bmore\_identify.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217130240/http:/typophile.com/files/bmore_identify.gif) | 14.14 KB |
author: Chris Rugen

comments.content:
Try this:  
 [Casablanca-rrcond-medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217130240/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/casablanca-rr/casablanca-rrcond-medium/index.html)

-----------------------------------------  
Yes, I'm old, but I'm back in style!

Yup. He's old, but he's still got a keen eye for type. ;-)

_Say Norbert, considering you're back, where were you ever gone from?_ ;-)

I left the Typographic world in '94 and warped over to multimedia and web publishing. At that time things that _moved_ interested me more than things that remained stagnant.

The only thing that inspired me to jump back into type lore was many comments by young designers I started to see on the web.

My favorite comment:  
Re: Favourite typeface/font!  
Reply #21 on: 1 Jun 05 by Stacey  
_I've been using Univers a bit recently. It's kind of a relaxed Frutiger... or something_

-------------------------------------  
Yes, I'm old, but I'm back in style!
Don't know how I missed that, but that's what extra sets of eyes and minds are for, I guess.

Chris,

I noticed on a few font sites that when you do a search by name or category, it doesn't always display the weight variants.

On dafont.com there is a check box for "show variants". That's how I spoted the condensed versions of Casablanca.
